page.title: 04CLUBS
page.content: The Women's Institute was formed in 1920 and has 65 members. There is an Air Gun Club which has been in existence for about sixty years and a Darby and Joan Club for the elderly which has 19 members. Girl Guides and Brownies meet weekly in Kingsland School but Scouts meet in Leominster. There is an Under-fives Group in Kingsland and also a Parent-Teacher Association which holds social, educational and fund-raising events in school. Also in Kingsland is a thriving Bowling Club, a Youth Club, a Bible Study Group (Interdenomination- al), the local branch of the British Legion and the "T'Far T'Go" Rafting Club. The latter takes part in the annual Raft Race down the River Wye. The Kingsland Show (horses, ponies and dogs) is held at Eyton.
